description: From French hippogriffe, from Ancient Greek ἵππος (híppos, “horse”) + γρύψ (grúps, “griffin”).

entries.meaning: a mythical beast, half griffin and half horse, supposedly the offspring of a griffin and a filly.
examples: To talk of being able to ride with stirrups, is trifling: get on Pegasus, bestride the hippogryph, or mount the white nag in the Revelation.
